*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_uploaad
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_upload .

  TYPES:
    BEGIN OF ltyp_matkl_prdha,
      matnr TYPE matnr,
      matkl TYPE matkl,
      prdha TYPE prodh_d,
    END OF ltyp_matkl_prdha.

  FIELD-SYMBOLS:
    <lfs_out> LIKE LINE OF gt_out.

  DATA:
    lt_import      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF gtyp_imp_exp,
    ls_import      TYPE gtyp_imp_exp,
    ls_import_ini  TYPE gtyp_imp_exp_ini,
    lt_filetable   TYPE filetable,
    ls_filetable   TYPE file_table,
    lt_csv         TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string,
    ls_csv         TYPE string,
    lt_assign      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF v_t001k_assign WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY werks,
    ls_assign      TYPE v_t001k_assign,
    lt_ta_01       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_ariba_ta_01 WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY bukrs,
    ls_ta_01       TYPE zmm_ariba_ta_01,
    lt_ta_03       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_ariba_ta_03 WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY werks lgort,
    ls_ta_03       TYPE zmm_ariba_ta_03,
    lt_ta_12       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_ariba_ta_12 WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY bukrs werks,
    ls_ta_12       TYPE zmm_ariba_ta_12,
    lt_consumos    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_consumos WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY werks lgort,
    ls_consumos    TYPE zmm_consumos,
    lt_matkl_prdha TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ltyp_matkl_prdha WITH NON-UNIQUE KEY matnr,
    ls_matkl_prdha TYPE ltyp_matkl_prdha,
    lv_prdha       TYPE prodh_d,
    lv_filename    TYPE string,
    lv_rows        TYPE int4,
    lv_tabix       TYPE sytabix,
    lv_rc          TYPE i.

  FREE: gt_out.
  CALL METHOD go_alv->refresh_table_display.

  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_open_dialog
    EXPORTING
      window_title            = 'Importar CSV'
      default_extension       = 'CSV'
      default_filename        = '*.CSV'
      file_filter             = '*.CSV'
      multiselection          = abap_false
    CHANGING
      file_table              = lt_filetable
      rc                      = lv_rc
    EXCEPTIONS
      file_open_dialog_failed = 1
      cntl_error              = 2
      error_no_gui            = 3
      not_supported_by_gui    = 4
      OTHERS                  = 5.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    FREE: lt_filetable.
  ENDIF.



  IF lt_filetable IS NOT INITIAL.
    READ TABLE lt_filetable INTO ls_filetable INDEX 1.
    lv_filename = ls_filetable.
    CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_UPLOAD'
      EXPORTING
        filename                = lv_filename
        filetype                = 'ASC'
        has_field_separator     = abap_true
        read_by_line            = 'X'
      TABLES
        data_tab                = lt_csv
      EXCEPTIONS
        file_open_error         = 1
        file_read_error         = 2
        no_batch                = 3
        gui_refuse_filetransfer = 4
        invalid_type            = 5
        no_authority            = 6
        unknown_error           = 7
        bad_data_format         = 8
        header_not_allowed      = 9
        separator_not_allowed   = 10
        header_too_long         = 11
        unknown_dp_error        = 12
        access_denied           = 13
        dp_out_of_memory        = 14
        disk_full               = 15
        dp_timeout              = 16
        OTHERS                  = 17.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.


    FREE: lt_import.
    LOOP AT lt_csv INTO ls_csv.
      FREE: ls_import, ls_import_ini.
      IF sy-tabix = 1.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.
      lv_tabix = sy-tabix - 1.
      SPLIT ls_csv AT ';' INTO ls_import_ini-matnr ls_import_ini-menge ls_import_ini-werks
                               ls_import_ini-lgort ls_import_ini-lfdat ls_import_ini-flief.

      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-matnr ) > 18.
        ls_import-matnr = ls_import_ini-matnr(18).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-matnr = ls_import_ini-matnr.
      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-menge ) > 16.
        ls_import-menge = ls_import_ini-menge(16).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-menge = ls_import_ini-menge.
      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-werks ) > 4.
        ls_import-werks = ls_import_ini-werks(4).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-werks = ls_import_ini-werks.
      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-lgort ) > 4.
        ls_import-lgort = ls_import_ini-lgort(4).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-lgort = ls_import_ini-lgort.
      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-lfdat ) > 10.
        ls_import_ini-lfdat = ls_import_ini-lfdat(10).
      ENDIF.
      IF strlen( ls_import_ini-flief ) > 10.
        ls_import-flief = ls_import_ini-flief(10).
      ELSE.
        ls_import-flief = ls_import_ini-flief.
      ENDIF.
      TRANSLATE ls_import-menge  USING ',.'.
      IF zcl_mm_generic=>check_numeric( ls_import-menge ) IS NOT INITIAL.
        FREE: gs_num_errors.
        gs_num_errors-index = lv_tabix.
        gs_num_errors-value = ls_import_ini-menge.
        APPEND gs_num_errors TO gt_num_errors.
        FREE: ls_import-menge.
      ENDIF.
      IF ls_import_ini-lfdat IS INITIAL.
        FREE: gs_date_errors, ls_import-lfdat.
        gs_date_errors-index = lv_tabix.
        gs_date_errors-value = ls_import_ini-lfdat.
        APPEND gs_date_errors TO gt_date_errors.
      ELSEIF zcl_mm_generic=>check_date( ls_import_ini-lfdat ) IS INITIAL.
        CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERT_DATE_TO_INTERNAL'
          EXPORTING
            date_external            = ls_import_ini-lfdat
*           ACCEPT_INITIAL_DATE      =
          IMPORTING
            date_internal            = ls_import-lfdat
          EXCEPTIONS
            date_external_is_invalid = 1
            OTHERS                   = 2.
        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
          FREE: ls_import-lfdat.
          FREE: gs_date_errors, ls_import-lfdat.
          gs_date_errors-index = lv_tabix.
          gs_date_errors-value = ls_import_ini-lfdat.
          APPEND gs_date_errors TO gt_date_errors.
        ENDIF.
      ELSE.
        FREE: ls_import-lfdat.
        FREE: gs_date_errors, ls_import-lfdat.
        gs_date_errors-index = lv_tabix.
        gs_date_errors-value = ls_import_ini-lfdat.
        APPEND gs_date_errors TO gt_date_errors.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND ls_import TO lt_import.
    ENDLOOP.


    FREE: gt_out.
    CALL METHOD go_alv->refresh_table_display.

    gt_out = CORRESPONDING #( lt_import ).
    gt_out_ini = gt_out.

    CALL FUNCTION 'VIEW_GET_DATA'
      EXPORTING
        view_name              = 'V_T001K_ASSIGN'
      TABLES
        data                   = lt_assign
      EXCEPTIONS
        no_viewmaint_tool      = 1
        no_authority           = 2
        no_auth_for_sel        = 3
        data_access_restricted = 4
        no_functiongroup       = 5
        OTHERS                 = 6.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      FREE: lt_assign.
    ENDIF.

    SELECT * FROM zmm_ariba_ta_01 INTO TABLE lt_ta_01 WHERE action = '01'.
    SELECT * FROM zmm_ariba_ta_03 INTO TABLE lt_ta_03.
    SELECT * FROM zmm_ariba_ta_12 INTO TABLE lt_ta_12.
    SELECT * FROM zmm_consumos    INTO TABLE lt_consumos.

    IF gt_out IS NOT INITIAL.
      LOOP AT gt_out ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_out>).
        CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_MATN1_INPUT'
              EXPORTING
                input         = <ls_out>-matnr
              IMPORTING
                output        = <ls_out>-matnr.
      ENDLOOP.

      SELECT matnr matkl prdha
        INTO TABLE lt_matkl_prdha
        FROM mara
         FOR ALL ENTRIES IN gt_out
       WHERE matnr = gt_out-matnr.
    ENDIF.

    FREE: gt_post.
    LOOP AT gt_out INTO gs_out.
      MOVE-CORRESPONDING gs_out TO gs_post.
      gs_post-ernam = sy-uname.
      READ TABLE lt_assign WITH KEY werks = gs_post-werks
                           INTO ls_assign .
      IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
        READ TABLE lt_ta_01 WITH TABLE KEY bukrs = ls_assign-bukrs
                            INTO ls_ta_01.
        IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
          gs_post-bsart = ls_ta_01-bbsrt.
          READ TABLE lt_matkl_prdha WITH TABLE KEY matnr = gs_post-matnr
                                    INTO ls_matkl_prdha.
          IF sy-subrc = 0.
            READ TABLE lt_ta_12 WITH KEY bukrs = ls_assign-bukrs
                                         werks = gs_post-werks
                                         prodh = ls_matkl_prdha-prdha
                                INTO ls_ta_12.
            IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
              gs_post-knttp = ls_ta_12-knttp.
            ELSE.
              READ TABLE lt_ta_12 WITH KEY bukrs = ls_assign-bukrs
                                         prodh = ls_matkl_prdha-prdha
                                INTO ls_ta_12.
              IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
                gs_post-knttp = ls_ta_12-knttp.
              ENDIF.
            ENDIF.
            IF gs_post-knttp = 'K'.
              READ TABLE lt_consumos WITH KEY werks = gs_post-werks
                                              lgort = gs_post-lgort
                                     INTO ls_consumos.
              IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
                gs_post-kostl = ls_consumos-kostl_c.
              ENDIF.
              CLEAR gs_post-ekorg. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/02025)
              LOOP AT lt_ta_03 INTO ls_ta_03 WHERE werks = gs_post-werks
                                               AND lgort = gs_post-lgort
                                               AND low_id_cat <= ls_matkl_prdha-matkl
                                               AND high_id_cat >= ls_matkl_prdha-matkl.
                gs_post-ekorg = ls_ta_03-ekorg.
                gs_post-ekgrp = ls_ta_03-ekgrp.
                EXIT.
              ENDLOOP.
              IF gs_post-ekorg IS INITIAL.
                LOOP AT lt_ta_03 INTO ls_ta_03 WHERE werks = gs_post-werks
                                               AND low_id_cat <= ls_matkl_prdha-matkl
                                               AND high_id_cat >= ls_matkl_prdha-matkl.
                  gs_post-ekorg = ls_ta_03-ekorg.
                  gs_post-ekgrp = ls_ta_03-ekgrp.
                  EXIT.
                ENDLOOP.
              ENDIF.
            ENDIF.
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
      APPEND gs_post TO gt_post.
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDIF.


ENDFORM.


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_download
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_download .

  DATA:
    lt_converted  TYPE  truxs_t_text_data,
    lt_converted1 TYPE  truxs_t_text_data,
    ls_converted  LIKE LINE OF lt_converted,
    lv_filename   TYPE string,
    lv_path       TYPE string,
    lv_fullpath   TYPE string.


  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_save_dialog
    EXPORTING
      window_title              = 'Exportar CSV'
      default_extension         = 'CSV'
      default_file_name         = '*.CSV'
      file_filter               = '*.CSV'
      prompt_on_overwrite       = 'X'
    CHANGING
      filename                  = lv_filename
      path                      = lv_path
      fullpath                  = lv_fullpath
    EXCEPTIONS
      cntl_error                = 1
      error_no_gui              = 2
      not_supported_by_gui      = 3
      invalid_default_file_name = 4
      OTHERS                    = 5.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    FREE: lv_filename , lv_path, lv_fullpath.
  ENDIF.

  IF lv_fullpath IS NOT INITIAL.

    ls_converted = 'CÃ³digo do Material;Quantidade;Centro;DepÃ³sito;Data de Remessa;Fornecedor Fixo'.
    APPEND ls_converted TO lt_converted.
    APPEND LINES OF lt_converted1 TO lt_converted.

    CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_DOWNLOAD'
      EXPORTING
*       BIN_FILESIZE            =
        filename                = lv_fullpath
*       FILETYPE                = 'ASC'
      TABLES
        data_tab                = lt_converted
*       FIELDNAMES              =
      EXCEPTIONS
        file_write_error        = 1
        no_batch                = 2
        gui_refuse_filetransfer = 3
        invalid_type            = 4
        no_authority            = 5
        unknown_error           = 6
        header_not_allowed      = 7
        separator_not_allowed   = 8
        filesize_not_allowed    = 9
        header_too_long         = 10
        dp_error_create         = 11
        dp_error_send           = 12
        dp_error_write          = 13
        unknown_dp_error        = 14
        access_denied           = 15
        dp_out_of_memory        = 16
        disk_full               = 17
        dp_timeout              = 18
        file_not_found          = 19
        dataprovider_exception  = 20
        control_flush_error     = 21
        OTHERS                  = 22.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
* Implement suitable error handling here
    ENDIF.

  ENDIF.

ENDFORM.


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_add_row
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_add_row .

  DATA:
    ls_out    TYPE zmm_log_st03,
    lv_new_id TYPE zmm_id,
    lv_lines  TYPE i.

  DESCRIBE TABLE gt_out LINES lv_lines.
  lv_new_id = lv_lines + 1.

  FREE: ls_out.
*  ls_out-id = lv_new_id.
  APPEND ls_out TO gt_out.


ENDFORM.


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_insert_row
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& text
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&      --> LV_INDEX
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_insert_row  USING pv_index TYPE i.

  DATA:
    gt_out1   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zmm_log_st03,
    ls_out    TYPE zmm_log_st03,
    lv_new_id TYPE  zmm_id.


  FREE: gt_out1.
  LOOP AT gt_out INTO ls_out.
    IF sy-tabix = pv_index.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.
    APPEND ls_out TO gt_out1.
  ENDLOOP.

*  lv_new_id = ls_out-id.
  FREE: ls_out.
*  ls_out-id = lv_new_id.
  APPEND ls_out TO gt_out1.

  LOOP AT gt_out INTO ls_out FROM pv_index.
*    ls_out-id = ls_out-id + 1.
    APPEND ls_out TO gt_out1.
  ENDLOOP.

  gt_out = gt_out1.

  CALL METHOD go_alv->refresh_table_display.


ENDFORM.


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_del_rows
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& text
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&      --> LT_ROWS
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_del_rows  USING pt_rows TYPE lvc_t_row.

  FIELD-SYMBOLS:
    <lfs_out> TYPE zmm_log_st03.

  DATA:
    ls_rows TYPE lvc_s_row.

  SORT pt_rows BY index DESCENDING.
  LOOP AT pt_rows INTO ls_rows.
    DELETE gt_out INDEX ls_rows-index.
  ENDLOOP.

*  LOOP AT gt_out ASSIGNING <lfs_out>.
*    <lfs_out>-id = sy-tabix.
*  ENDLOOP.

  CALL METHOD go_alv->refresh_table_display.

ENDFORM.


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Form f_post
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f_post .

  TYPES:
    BEGIN OF ltyp_keys,
      bsart TYPE bbsrt,
      ekorg TYPE ekorg,
      ekgrp TYPE ekgrp,
      werks TYPE werks_d,
    END OF ltyp_keys.

  DATA:
    BEGIN: OF lt_excl OCCURS 0,
      code TYPE syst_ucomm,
    END OF lt_excl.

  DATA:
    lt_keys       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ltyp_keys,
    ls_keys       TYPE ltyp_keys,
    ls_out        TYPE zmm_log_st03,
    lt_rows       TYPE lvc_t_row,
    lt_pritem	    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqitemimp,
    ls_pritem	    TYPE bapimereqitemimp,
    lt_pritemx    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqitemx,
    ls_pritemx    TYPE bapimereqitemx,
    lt_praccount  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqaccount,
    ls_praccount  TYPE bapimereqaccount,
    lt_praccountx TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqaccountx,
    ls_praccountx TYPE bapimereqaccountx,
    lt_return     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiret2,
    ls_return	    TYPE bapiret2,
    ls_prheader   TYPE bapimereqheader,
    ls_prheaderx  TYPE bapimereqheaderx,
    ls_code       TYPE bapi2017_gm_code,
    lv_number	    TYPE banfn,
    lv_msg        TYPE char200,
    lv_error      TYPE xfeld,
    lv_posted     TYPE i,
    lv_posted_c   TYPE char10,
    lv_items      TYPE i,
    lv_items_c    TYPE char10,
    lv_tabix      TYPE sytabix,
    lv_lines      TYPE i,
    lt_itemsource TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF BAPIMEREQSOURCE.


  CALL METHOD go_alv->get_selected_rows
    IMPORTING
      et_index_rows = lt_rows.

  IF lt_rows IS INITIAL.
    MESSAGE s194(zmm) DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
    EXIT.
  ENDIF.

  DESCRIBE TABLE gt_post LINES lv_lines.
  lv_tabix = lv_lines.
  DO lv_lines TIMES.
    READ TABLE lt_rows WITH KEY index = lv_tabix
                       TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS.
    IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
      DELETE gt_post INDEX lv_tabix.
    ENDIF.
    SUBTRACT 1 FROM lv_tabix.
  ENDDO.

  CALL FUNCTION 'POPUP_CONTINUE_YES_NO'
    EXPORTING
      defaultoption = 'N'
      textline1     = 'Prosseguir?'(t07)
      textline2     = ' '
      titel         = 'ConfirmaÃ§Ã£o'(t05)
      start_column  = 25
      start_row     = 6
    IMPORTING
      answer        = gv_answer.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    FREE gv_answer.
  ENDIF.
  IF gv_answer <> 'J'.
    EXIT.
  ENDIF.


  lt_keys = CORRESPONDING #( gt_post ).

  SORT lt_keys.
  DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_keys.

  FREE: lt_excl.
  APPEND '&POST' TO lt_excl.
  SET PF-STATUS 'STLI' EXCLUDING lt_excl.
  LEAVE TO LIST-PROCESSING.

  DATA lv_count TYPE i. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)

  FREE: lv_posted, lv_posted_c, lv_items, lv_items_c.
  LOOP AT lt_keys INTO ls_keys.

    FREE: ls_prheader, ls_prheaderx, lt_pritem, lt_pritemx, lt_praccount, lt_praccountx.

    ls_prheader-pr_type = ls_keys-bsart.
    ls_prheaderx-pr_type = abap_true.

* EXT_DSMF (10/10/2025) - START - issue #482
    ls_prheader-auto_source = 'X'.
    ls_prheaderx-auto_source = abap_true.
* END


    lv_count = 1. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)

    LOOP AT gt_post INTO gs_post WHERE bsart = ls_keys-bsart
                                   AND ekorg = ls_keys-ekorg
                                   AND ekgrp = ls_keys-ekgrp
                                   AND werks = ls_keys-werks.
      FREE: ls_pritem, ls_pritemx, ls_praccount, ls_praccountx.

      "ls_pritem-preq_item = sy-tabix.
      ls_pritem-preq_item = lv_count. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)
*      ls_pritem-purch_org = ls_keys-ekorg.
      ls_pritem-pur_group = gs_post-ekgrp.
      ls_pritem-preq_name = gs_post-ernam.
      ls_pritem-acctasscat = gs_post-knttp.
      ls_pritem-material = gs_post-matnr.
      ls_pritem-plant = gs_post-werks.
      ls_pritem-store_loc = gs_post-lgort. " EXT_DMSF (22/08/2025) - ignorar o DepÃ³sito (validar apenas o Centro)
      ls_pritem-quantity = gs_post-menge.
      ls_pritem-preq_date = sy-datum. " EXT_DMSF (02/10/2025) - atualizaÃ§Ã£o da data de solicitaÃ§Ã£o
      ls_pritem-deliv_date = gs_post-lfdat. " EXT_DMSF (02/10/2025) - atualizaÃ§Ã£o da data de remessa do item
*      ls_pritem-fixed_vend = gs_post-flief.

* EXT_DMSF (16/10/2025) - START
      SELECT meins INTO @DATA(lv_pounit)
        FROM mara
        WHERE matnr = @GS_post-matnr.
      ENDSELECT.

      ls_pritem-po_unit = lv_pounit.
      ls_pritem-po_unit_iso = lv_pounit.
* END

      IF ls_pritem-fixed_vend IS NOT INITIAL.
        UNPACK ls_pritem-fixed_vend TO ls_pritem-fixed_vend.
      ENDIF.

      "ls_pritemx-preq_item = sy-tabix.
      ls_pritemx-preq_item = lv_count. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)
*      ls_pritemx-purch_org = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-pur_group = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-preq_name = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-acctasscat = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-material = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-plant = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-store_loc = abap_true. " EXT_DMSF (22/08/2025) - ignorar o DepÃ³sito (validar apenas o Centro)
      ls_pritemx-quantity = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-preq_date = abap_true.
      ls_pritemx-deliv_date = abap_true. " EXT_DMSF (02/10/2025) - atualizaÃ§Ã£o da data de remessa do item
*      ls_pritemx-fixed_vend = abap_true.

      ls_pritemx-po_unit = abap_true. " EXT_DMSF (16/10/2025)
      ls_pritemx-po_unit_iso = abap_true. " EXT_DMSF (16/10/2025)

      APPEND:
        ls_pritem  TO lt_pritem,
        ls_pritemx TO lt_pritemx.
      " NS - 16/09/2025 - Begin - Fix error ME 083 Enter cost center
      IF ls_pritem-distrib IS INITIAL.
        ls_praccount-serial_no = '01'.
        ls_praccountx-serial_no = '01'.
        ls_praccountx-serial_nox = abap_true.
      ENDIF.
      " NS - 16/09/2025 - End
      "ls_praccount-preq_item = sy-tabix.
      ls_praccount-preq_item = lv_count. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)
      ls_praccount-costcenter = gs_post-kostl.
      "ls_praccountx-preq_item = sy-tabix.
      ls_praccountx-preq_item = lv_count. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)
      ls_praccountx-costcenter = abap_true.
      APPEND:
        ls_praccount TO lt_praccount,
        ls_praccountx TO lt_praccountx.

      lv_count = lv_count + 1. " EXT_DMSF (30/09/2025)
    ENDLOOP.

    CONCATENATE '->' ls_keys-bsart ls_keys-ekorg ls_keys-ekgrp ls_keys-werks INTO lv_msg SEPARATED BY space.
    WRITE: / lv_msg COLOR 3.

    CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_PR_CREATE'
      EXPORTING
        prheader   = ls_prheader
        prheaderx  = ls_prheaderx
*       TESTRUN    =
      IMPORTING
        number     = lv_number
*       PRHEADEREXP                  =
      TABLES
        return     = lt_return
        pritem     = lt_pritem
        pritemx    = lt_pritemx
*       PRITEMEXP  =
        pritemsource = lt_itemsource
        praccount  = lt_praccount
*       PRACCOUNTPROITSEGMENT        =
        praccountx = lt_praccountx
*       PRADDRDELIVERY               =
*       PRITEMTEXT =
*       PRHEADERTEXT                 =
*       EXTENSIONIN                  =
*       EXTENSIONOUT                 =
*       PRVERSION  =
*       PRVERSIONX =
*       ALLVERSIONS                  =
*       PRCOMPONENTS                 =
*       PRCOMPONENTSX                =
*       SERVICEOUTLINE               =
*       SERVICEOUTLINEX              =
*       SERVICELINES                 =
*       SERVICELINESX                =
*       SERVICELIMIT                 =
*       SERVICELIMITX                =
*       SERVICECONTRACTLIMITS        =
*       SERVICECONTRACTLIMITSX       =
*       SERVICEACCOUNT               =
*       SERVICEACCOUNTX              =
*       SERVICELONGTEXTS             =
*       SERIALNUMBER                 =
*       SERIALNUMBERX                =
      .

    FREE: lv_msg, lv_error.
    DELETE lt_return WHERE id = 'BAPI'.
    SORT lt_return.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_return.
    SORT lt_return BY type.
    LOOP AT lt_return INTO ls_return.
      FREE: lv_msg.
      IF ls_return-row IS NOT INITIAL.
        WRITE ls_return-row TO lv_msg LEFT-JUSTIFIED.
        CONCATENATE 'Linha:' lv_msg INTO lv_msg SEPARATED BY space.
      ENDIF.
      IF lv_msg IS NOT INITIAL.
        CONCATENATE lv_msg '=>' ls_return-type ls_return-id ls_return-number ls_return-message
                    INTO lv_msg SEPARATED BY space.
      ELSE.
        CONCATENATE ls_return-type ls_return-id ls_return-number ls_return-message
                    INTO lv_msg SEPARATED BY space.
      ENDIF.
      IF ls_return-type = 'E' OR ls_return-type = 'A'.
        lv_error = abap_true.
        WRITE: / lv_msg COLOR 6.
      ELSE.
        WRITE: / lv_msg COLOR 2.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    IF lv_error IS INITIAL.
      ADD 1 TO lv_posted.
      DESCRIBE TABLE lt_pritem LINES lv_lines.
      ADD lv_lines TO lv_items.
      CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
        EXPORTING
          wait = abap_true.

* EXT_DMSF (02/10/2025) - START - ImplementaÃ§Ã£o Cap 3.3

      DATA: lt_erev TYPE TABLE OF erev,
            ls_erev TYPE erev.

      SELECT * FROM erev
        INTO TABLE lt_erev
        WHERE edokn = lv_number.

      LOOP AT lt_erev INTO ls_erev.

        ls_erev-revno = '0'.
        ls_erev-revok = 'X'.

        MODIFY erev FROM ls_erev.

      ENDLOOP.

      DELETE FROM erev WHERE edokn = lv_number AND revok <> 'X'.

      UPDATE eban
        SET banpr = '02'
        WHERE banfn = lv_number.

* END

* EXT_DMSF (21/10/2025) - START

      DATA:
            lt_selectresults TYPE TABLE OF eban,
            ls_selectresult TYPE eban,
            ls_temppritem TYPE bapimereqitemimp,
            lv_flief TYPE flief,
            ls_prheaderxp TYPE BAPIMEREQHEADER,
            lt_returnchange TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiret2,
            lt_pritemchange	TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqitemimp,
            ls_pritemchange TYPE bapimereqitemimp,
            lt_pritemxchange TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqitemx,
            ls_pritemxchange TYPE bapimereqitemx.

      SELECT * INTO TABLE lt_selectresults
        FROM eban
        WHERE banfn = lv_number.

      LOOP AT lt_pritem INTO ls_temppritem.

        READ TABLE lt_selectresults INTO ls_selectresult
          WITH KEY bnfpo = ls_temppritem-preq_item.

        IF sy-subrc = 0.

          lv_flief = gt_post[ ls_temppritem-preq_item ]-flief.
          lv_flief = |{ lv_flief ALPHA = IN }|.

          IF ls_selectresult-flief <> lv_flief.

            ls_pritemchange-preq_item = ls_temppritem-preq_item.
            ls_pritemchange-fixed_vend = lv_flief.
            ls_pritemchange-agreement = ''.
            ls_pritemchange-agmt_item = ''.
            ls_pritemchange-info_rec = ''.
            APPEND ls_pritemchange TO lt_pritemchange.

            ls_pritemxchange-preq_item = ls_temppritem-preq_item.
            ls_pritemxchange-fixed_vend = abap_true.
            ls_pritemxchange-agreement = abap_true.
            ls_pritemxchange-agmt_item = abap_true.
            ls_pritemxchange-info_rec = abap_true.
            APPEND ls_pritemxchange TO lt_pritemxchange.

            CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_PR_CHANGE'
              EXPORTING
                number = lv_number
              IMPORTING
                prheaderexp = ls_prheaderxp
              TABLES
                return = lt_returnchange
                pritem = lt_pritemchange
                pritemx = lt_pritemxchange.
          ENDIF.

        ENDIF.

      ENDLOOP.

      CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
        EXPORTING
          wait = abap_true.

* END

      FREE: lv_msg.
      MESSAGE ID 'ZMM' TYPE 'S' NUMBER 196 WITH lv_number INTO lv_msg.
      WRITE: / lv_msg COLOR 2.
    ENDIF.

  ENDLOOP.


  IF lv_posted > 0.
    WRITE lv_posted TO lv_posted_c LEFT-JUSTIFIED.
    WRITE lv_items  TO lv_items_c  LEFT-JUSTIFIED.
    MESSAGE s193(zmm) WITH lv_posted_c lv_items_c.
  ENDIF.
  SET SCREEN 0.
  LEAVE SCREEN.

ENDFORM.

This program significantly reduces manual effort, improves data quality, and ensures consistency when creating large volumes of Purchase Requisitions. If anyone has implemented similar tools or has suggestions for enhancements, Iâ€™d be happy to discuss ideas!

Thanks for reading! ðŸ‘‹

entry.title: Getting started with Joule-For ABAP Developers
entry.content:
Getting started with Joule-For ABAP Developers

Recently, I got the opportunity to attend a hands-on workshop session organized by SAP on Joule for developers.  The session covered its integration with SAP Build as well as ABAP. As I am into ABAP, hereâ€™s a quick startup blog on Joule for developers-ABAP. Letâ€™s quickly get to the overview of Joule.

What is Joule?

Joule is an AI copilot inside SAP, that understands normal conversations, so itâ€™s your smart coworker in SAP that operates on cloud (BTP) and can help in fetching quick data, generating reports and even suggesting code or code modifications, which in turn makes your life much easier.

Key Features:

  • Conversational Interface
  • Integration with SAP Apps
  • Enterprise Ready
  • Tailored for your business
  • Automatic updates
  • Create custom package

Benefits:

  • Faster work
  • Smarter Insights
  • Better outcomes
  • Full control

With that overview in place, let's begin with how we can use Joule while working on the developments in Eclipse.

Add Joule in Eclipse

       1. Create Package

  • First step is to create a package using below steps:
  • In the cloud system in eclipse under Favourite packages, right click on ZLOCAL package.
  • Create a new sub package with your unique group id.
  •  Maintain the required information like package name and description and click next.
  • Next screen will display Package type, S/W component and Transport layer.
  • Select Package Type â€œDevelopmentâ€ and click â€œNextâ€.
  • Create/Select the required TR and click on â€œFinishâ€.
  • Package will get created.

          

        2. Create Artifacts

        Created Odata service from scratch for a travel application using        /DMO/TRAVEL_DATA and /DMO/BOOKING_DATA structures.  Steps are given below:

  • Right click on the package.
  • Select â€œGenerate ABAP Repository Objectsâ€.

         

  • Select â€œOData UI service from scratchâ€.

       

  • Click â€˜Nextâ€™ and select the required package.
  • Click â€˜Nextâ€™ to finish and enable the joule.
  • Joule is now active and will be displayed on right side as shown below:

How to use Joule

We can give prompts for Joule to create objects in the system. For example, to create the application, paste the below prompt in Joule window:

â€œCreate a transaction application for travel management. Create the entity Travel based on the structure /DMO/TRAVEL_DATA. The second entity is Booking based on /DMO/BOOKING_DATA. â€œ

Joule will respond by displaying the list of objects that will be created. If there are not further modifications, we can just click on â€œAcceptâ€:

Then, click on next and select the previously created TR and click on â€œFinishâ€.

The application for travel management will get created and in the project explorer all the generated objects will get displayed:

We can also give further prompt to add new fields, or if we need any other modifications. Make sure to click Accept every time you are adding new objects. Also, before continuing and generating the RAP BO, make sure you check for all the required fields and objects in your data model.

Explaining Artifacts

Joule can even provide the details of the artifacts. So, if we need Joule to explain any of the objects,

  • Right click on the artifact that we want the details for, Select Joule->Explain.
  • Joule will be displayed on right with all the required explanation about the artifact selected.
  • Here one can ask further questions as well.

Notes:

Generated objects should always end with suffix â€œ###â€ (follow naming conventions)-replace ### with your group ID.

SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Understanding GOS Attachments and Their Backend Tables in SAP ABAP
entry.content:
Introduction

Generic Object Services (GOS) play a crucial role in SAP by allowing users to attach documents, notes, and URLs to business objects such as Purchase Orders, Accounting Documents, Materials, and Customer Masters.
For ABAP developers and functional consultants, understanding how these attachments are stored and retrieved at the database level is essential for reporting, audits, migrations, and enhancements.

This article explains the core tables, object relationships, and practical ABAP insights related to GOS attachments.

What Are GOS Attachments?

GOS (Generic Object Services) enables users to:

  • Attach files (PDF, Excel, etc.)

  • Create notes

  • Link external documents

These attachments are visible via Services for Object in SAP GUI transactions like:

  • ME23N (Purchase Order)

  • FB03 (Accounting Document)

  • MM03 (Material Master)

Key Tables Used for GOS Attachments

1. SRGBTBREL â€“ Relationship Table

This is the most important table for GOS.

  • Stores the relationship between:

    • Business Object (e.g., BUS2012, BKPF, KNA1)

    • Attachment or note

  • Common fields:

    • TYPEID_A â€“ Business object type

    • INSTID_A â€“ Object key (e.g., PO number, document number)

    • RELTYPE â€“ ATTA (Attachment), NOTE, URL

âœ… Used to check whether an attachment exists.

2. SOOD / SOFM / SOC3 (SAPoffice Documents)

  • Stores SAPoffice document metadata and content

  • Often used when attachments are created as SAPoffice objects

  • Can be read using:

    • SO_OBJECT_READ

    • SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1

3. DRAD (DMS-Based Attachments)

If attachments are stored using Document Management System (DMS):

  • Table: DRAD

  • Object key may contain:

    • Material Number

    • Equipment

    • Other master data keys

How to Identify Attachments for a Business Object

Example: Purchase Order (ME23N)

  • Business Object: BUS2012

  • Table: SRGBTBREL

  • Filter:

    • TYPEID_A = 'BUS2012'

    • INSTID_A = <PO Number>

If an entry exists â†’ attachment is present.

Common Use Cases

  • Audit reports to find documents without attachments

  • Mass download of attachments

  • Migration from Content Server / FileNet / SharePoint

  • Custom reports showing attachment count

  • Enhancing attachment list display

Important Notes

  • There is no direct T-code to attachment mapping

  • Attachments are linked to Business Objects, not transactions

  • Same attachment can be visible in multiple transactions

Conclusion

Understanding GOS attachment architecture helps SAP professionals build robust reports, support audits, and design scalable document solutions.
Tables like SRGBTBREL, SOOD, and DRAD are essential tools in every ABAP developerâ€™s toolkit.

If you frequently work with attachments, mastering these relationships will save significant time and effort.

entry.title: Custom Entity With Actions
entry.content:
What is a Custom Entity in RAP? 

In the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), a Custom Entity is a CDS entity that does not map to a database table. Instead, it represents virtual data provided by custom ABAP logic. It is used when: 

  • You need to expose calculated or external data. 
  • You want to integrate non-database sources (e.g., APIs, external systems). 
  • You require custom operations beyond standard CRUD. 

Adding an Action to a Custom Entity allows you to trigger specific business operations directly from the UI. 

Now we will look at one practical example for Custom Entity with an Action in RAP, where the action will be performed based on the user click on the button called CustomAction , when user clicks on it the icon will be changed. 

First, we will begin by creating a database table with the fields shown in the screenshot below. 

Next, we will create a Custom Entity and define its implementation class, as the Custom Entity will be realized through the logic implemented in that class "ZGA_CL_QRY_PRVD_C_ACT". 

Now, we will implement the logic in the class and use the mandatory interface IF_RAP_QUERY_PROVIDER to handle data retrieval for the Custom Entity. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

To adjust the data, we have implemented another class named ZGA_CL_BS_DEMO_ADJUST_DATA. 

Our next task is to create a Behavior Definition for the Custom Entity ZGA_I_CUST_ACT_DEMO to enable actions and logic implementation.

Next, we dive into implementing the Behavior Definition logic in the class ZBP_GA_I_CUST_ACT_DEMO. 

The class shown below serves as the buffer class, which we have utilized in our Behavior Implementation class.

Our next task is to create the Service Definition and Service Binding, enabling the UI to consume the Custom Entity and its actions.

 

Output:

Once an instance is selected, clicking CustomAction will dynamically update the icon, as displayed in the screenshot. 

The Reset button is used to restore all icons to their original state. 

Conclusion 

Custom Entities with Actions in SAP RAP provide a powerful way to implement dynamic, user-driven functionality without relying on database persistence. In this example, we demonstrated how to create a Custom Entity and enhance it with two actions. 

By leveraging actions, you can enrich your applications with flexible business logic, improve user engagement, and maintain a clean separation between UI and backend logic. This approach is ideal for scenarios where you need virtual data handling combined with interactive operations.

entry.title: Why Vectorized Master Data is Critical for AI on SAP ECC and S/4HANA
entry.content:
Why Most AI Agents Fail with SAP Data

AI Agents are rapidly becoming part of enterprise landscapes, and SAP ECC and S/4HANA are obvious targets for automation. However, what we see in the market today is concerning.

Most agentic solutions attempt to consume SAP data through custom coding. This approach creates three major problems:

  1. High development and maintenance costs

  2. Multiple, inefficient calls to the SAP backend

  3. Mass data extraction, where AI Agents pull entire tables just to find a few relevant records

In many of the solutions we reviewed, including agentic SDKs integrations such as Joule, n8n, ChatGPT, and Claude, AI Agents frequently fail, time out, or request all records from SAP ERP systems with minimal filtering. This is inefficient, risky, and completely unnecessary.

At Skybuffer AI, we believe there is a better way.

The Foundation: Preparing SAP Data for AI Consumption

Data preparation is the key to successful AI-driven automation. While topics like data silos and data quality are well known, they cannot be fully solved overnight. Instead of fighting this reality, Skybuffer AI introduces a simple and reliable data layer that AI Agents can consume efficiently.

Skybuffer AI uses SAP master data vectorization to enable fast, accurate access to SAP ECC and S/4HANA data from agentic workflows. Any SAP master data table, including views and CDS views, can be vectorized and materialized using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

Key capabilities include:

  • Support for full and delta loads

  • Near real-time synchronization with SAP

  • A scalable, AI-ready representation of SAP master data

 Pic. 1 Skybuffer AI â€“ SAP Data Vectorization Configuration

Performance at Enterprise Scale

A common concern is performance. Vectorizing SAP master data row by row would indeed be slow, if done sequentially.

Skybuffer AI solves this with parallel embedding execution, allowing vectorization at enterprise scale. On servers with 8 GPUs, Skybuffer AI can process up to 1 million records in 30 minutes. That is scalable in case even faster vectorization solution is needed.

More importantly, once initial vectorization is complete, a self-healing delta mechanism ensures that only new or changed records are processed. This keeps the data current without impacting performance.

Business Value: Why This Approach Matters

The benefits are immediate and measurable:

  • No coding for intelligent master data search

  • No multiple calls to SAP backend systems

  • No full-table reads triggered by AI Agents

  • Faster, more reliable AI-driven processes

Consider a real-world scenario:
A vendor invoice arrives by email.

Pic. 2 Real Consumption-Based Invoice Example

The AI Agent reads the email and attachment, extracts the vendor name exactly as written on the invoice, and needs the corresponding SAP vendor number. Instead of querying SAP repeatedly or scanning entire tables, the Agent performs one single RAG search against vectorized SAP master data.

Within milliseconds, the correct vendor record is returned. It is accurate, up to date, and ready for posting in SAP.

Pic. 3 Skybuffer AI â€“ Fast and Reliable SAP Data Search Using Data Vectorization

No coding. No overload. No hallucinations.

Applicable Across Many SAP Use Cases

The same approach works seamlessly across multiple scenarios, including:

  • Finding SAP users or business objects by name, email address, or other attributes

  • Creating Sales Orders in SAP from customer Purchase Orders

  • Resolving customer and material master data automatically

  • Creating Bills of Materials and routings from Excel files managed by R&D teams

  • Posting Service Entry Sheets

  • Rapidly enabling new use cases by simply nominating tables for vectorization

If the data exists in SAP, it can be prepared for AI consumption.

Built-In Authorization and Security

Security is not an afterthought.

Skybuffer AI applies the same concept used in AI assistants for Teams, Copilot, and Joule, so vectorized data accessed by users with an additional safeguard. Once the AI Agent selects relevant records via RAG, Skybuffer AI retrieves those records directly from SAP using SSO within the active conversation session, before providing data to the user.

This ensures:

  • Users only see data they are authorized to access in SAP

  • Vectorized data never bypasses SAP authorization rules

  • Enterprise-grade compliance and governance

Seamless Integration with Existing AI Agents

Already running AI Agents and just need access to SAP data?

Skybuffer AI provides an MCP Server, allowing your existing agentic solutions to consume vectorized SAP data without replacing your current platform. This makes Skybuffer AI an enabler, not a disruptor.

 Pic. 4 Skybuffer AI â€“ MCP Server for Integration with Agentic SDK

Flexible Deployment: Cloud or On-Premise

Skybuffer AI is built on SAP HANA and can be deployed:

  • On-premise within your own infrastructure

  • In your SAP BTP tenant

A modern SAP UI5 user interface ensures an intuitive and productive user experience for both IT and business users.

Conclusion

SAP ECC and S/4HANA master data vectorization is the missing link between SAP and AI Agents.

With Skybuffer AI, enterprises can:

  • Eliminate coding

  • Avoid hallucinations

  • Reduce SAP backend load

  • Enable fast, secure, and reliable AI-driven processes

This is how SAP data becomes truly AI-ready.
